meaningMnemonic: When you <kanji>compete</kanji> to the point of <kanji>conflict</kanji>, you know that this person / entity is your <vocabulary>competition</vocabulary>. Gotta beat out that competition. For example, in order to beat out the competition, WaniKani has a mascot that can eat every other small furry animal that the competition has for their mascot. Case closed.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
